creditline: Gift of David Tausig Frank and Kazukuni Sugiyama
description: paper carton is wrapped in brown paper; wooden box with inscriptions inside; fabric is light green/grey; image of tree branches in black ink with inscription in LL corner
inscription:
梅花皎然白　其上明月閑　春色満千里　一枝天地間　暗香入流水　疎影動空山　冷々嘸相見　高々不可攀 (?)
朏知香々則花帥古不提舌是　吾家画訣豈漫池有哉 {?} (?)

Poem: Seisho sanbō shū no. 84
markings: poem URC red seal: 筆補造化 {hippo zōka}; poem UR red seal: 無邪 {muja}; LL red seals: 福田世耕 {Fukuda Seikō} [Fukuda Seikō #4], 静處 {seisho} [seisho #4]; LLC: 静 {sei} [sei #1], 處 {sho} [sho #1]
signed: LRC: 丙子春日於鹿谷寓居古人畫并題 {hinoe-ne shunjitsu oite bōkoku gūkyo Kojin ga narabini dai} (A spring day in 1936 at Temporary Abode in Shishigatani, painting and inscription by Kojin) part 1; 拙則真々　則古師古　不摸古道　吾家畫訣　豈復他有哉　碧翁題 (“Clumsy!” then it’s truly real: / Take the past as your rule, take the past as your master. / Yet not to touch upon the past is / The secret of my school of painting! How could there be anything more to it than that? Inscription by Hekiō) part 2
title: Old Plum
